Image.Text: Oh, a new face! Welcome, welcome. [row] I am Markovnikov, and you may know me by my research on Electrophilic Substitution?

Markovnikov's Rule observes chemical behaviour during Electrophilic Substitution. For instance, An Alkene can react with Hydrogen Halides to produce HalogenoAlkanes. The rule determines which Carbon atom the H-species and the Halogen-speces will go to! [row] But enough about that, would you like to know more about Alkenes?

Markovnikov's Rule observes chemical behaviour during Electrophilic Substitution. For instance, An Alkene can react with Hydrogen Halides to produce HalogenoAlkanes. The rule determines which Carbon atom the H-species and the Halogen-speces will go to! [row] But enough about that, would you like to know more about Alkenes?

Alkenes are incredibly useful organic compounds! They can undergo Addition Polymerization to create polymers, aka plastics! Depending on the reactant they can become Alkanes, Halogenoalkanes, Alcohols, etc. [row] Let us test your knowledge, shall we?
I like your spirit lass! Let the experiment begin.
Another time then. Hope you enjoy our city!
Another time then. Hope you enjoy our city lass!
That's the spirit! Let's begin the experiment!
Absolutely amazing young chemist. You have a lot of potential in you!
